titles.title: Internet Election Information Act of 1997

To amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to permit interactive computer services to provide their facilities free of charge to candidates for Federal offices for the purpose of disseminating campaign information and enhancing public debate.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Oversight.

bill.summary: 02/06/1997--Introduced. Internet Election Information Act of 1997 - Amends the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to exempt from the contribution and expenditure provisions of such Act donated interactive computer services and the direct costs incurred for such services by an interactive computer service, if the service permits its facilities to be used for such purposes by all candidates in the election for the same office. Defines the term "interactive computer service."
